alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 14 at 3:44AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: .Area of moderate to locally heavy rain is progressing east. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Vermont, northeast Vermont and northwest Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Orange and Washington. In northeast Vermont, Caledonia, Essex and Orleans. In northwest Vermont, Eastern Chittenden, Eastern Franklin and Lamoille. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Portions of central Vermont and the Northeast Kingdom have received 1.25 to 2.25 inches of rain, and an additional 0.75 to 1.50 inches is expected. Combined with recent leaf fall, this may result in urban and poor drainage areas to experience ponding or localized flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington
